alert.note: Alert for Monroe Lower Keys (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Key West (Key West - The Florida Keys)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 12:45PM EDT by NWS Key West
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Lower Keys in Monroe County through 115 PM EDT... At 1244 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles south of Little Palm Island Resort, or 11 miles south of Spanish Harbor Channel Bridge, moving north at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Niles Channel Bridge, Spanish Harbor Channel Bridge, Little Torch Key, Upper Sugarloaf Key, Middle Torch Key, Little Palm Island Resort, Big Torch Key, Summerland Key, Big Pine Key and Ramrod Key. This includes US 1 between mile markers 16 and 35. This includes US 1 between mile markers 16 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
